articles.author: Uditha Jayasinghe
articles.description: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake's coalition, the National People's Power (NPP), was set to win a majority in a snap general election, results from the Indian Ocean island's poll body showed on Friday.
articles.title: Sri Lankan president's coalition set for majority in snap election

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike flattened a building near one of the busiest traffic junctions in the Lebanese capital.
articles.title: Israel hits Beirut suburb after US delivers truce proposal

articles.author: Michael Martina, Trevor Hunnicutt, Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te is planning to stop in Hawaii and maybe Guam on a visit to Taipei's diplomatic allies in the Pacific in the coming weeks, sources told Reuters, a sensitive trip coming shortly after the U.S. election.
articles.title: Exclusive: Taiwan president plans Hawaii visit on sensitive trip to Pacific, sources say

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: On the last day of January, a woman took her son to see paediatrician Nadezhda Buyanova at Polyclinic No. 140 in northwest Moscow. The boy, aged seven, had a problem with one of his eyes.
articles.title: In echo of Soviet era, Russians are informing on each other over Ukraine

articles.author: Gloria Dickie, Simon Jessop
articles.description: A group of conflict-affected countries is pushing at COP29 to double financial aid to more than $20 billion a year to combat the natural disaster and security crises facing their populations, a letter seen by Reuters showed.
articles.title: Fragile countries make $20 billion climate finance push at COP29, letter says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean court convicted on Friday main opposition party leader Lee Jae-myung on charges of violating the election law, handing him a one-year prison sentence suspended for two years, the Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea opposition leader convicted of violating election law, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Margaryta Chornokondratenko, Yurii Kovalenko
articles.description: On her way to hospital to give birth to her fourth child nearly three years ago, Ukrainian Liudmyla Rodchenko said she saw the bodies of civilians strewn along the street covered by blankets.
articles.title: Born into war, Ukraine toddlers adjust as conflict nears 1,000 days

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Marco Aquino, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived in Lima on Thursday, kicking off a week-long diplomatic blitz in Latin America by inaugurating the massive Chancay deep-water port, one of Beijing's most ambitious infrastructure investments in Latin America.
articles.title: China's Xi arrives in Lima for APEC, to open Pacific megaport

articles.author: Anthony Boadle, Eduardo Simões
articles.description: A failed bomb attack on Brazil's Supreme Court looks set to re-unite Brasilia against far-right radicalism and scuttle a possible comeback by former President Jair Bolsonaro, who is fighting a court decision to bar him from the ballot.
articles.title: Brazil bomb attack hurts Bolsonaro comeback efforts, deepening political divide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Croatia's Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic dismissed Health Minister Vili Beros after police raided his home on Friday morning investigating corruption, Hina state news agency reported.
articles.title: Croatian PM Plenkovic sacks health minister after corruption raid
